seg-source.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_BACKUP_DATABASE system procedure

target.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_BACKUP_DATABASE system procedure

trans-unit.source: The <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_BACKUP_DATABASE</codeph> system procedure backs up the database to a specified backup directory.

seg-source.mrk: The <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_BACKUP_DATABASE</codeph> system procedure backs up the database to a specified backup directory.

target.mrk: The <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_BACKUP_DATABASE</codeph> system procedure backs up the database to a specified backup directory.

seg-source.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_BACKUP_DATABASE system procedure

seg-source.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_BACKUP_DATABASE

target.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_BACKUP_DATABASE

trans-unit.source: See "Using the backup procedures to perform an online backup" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph> for more information on using this procedure.

seg-source.mrk: See "Using the backup procedures to perform an online backup" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph> for more information on using this procedure.

target.mrk: See "Using the backup procedures to perform an online backup" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph> for more information on using this procedure.

seg-source.mrk: Syntax

target.mrk: Syntax

seg-source.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_BACKUP_DATABASE(IN BACKUPDIR VARCHAR())

target.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_BACKUP_DATABASE(IN BACKUPDIR VARCHAR())

trans-unit.source: No result is returned from the procedure.

seg-source.mrk: No result is returned from the procedure.

target.mrk: No result is returned from the procedure.

seg-source.mrk: BACKUPDIR

target.mrk: BACKUPDIR

trans-unit.source: An input argument of type VARCHAR(32672) that specifies the path to a directory, where the backup should be stored. Relative paths are resolved based on the current user directory, <filepath>user.dir</filepath>, of the JVM where the database backup is occurring. Relative paths are not resolved based on the derby home directory. To avoid confusion, use the absolute path.

seg-source.mrk: An input argument of type VARCHAR(32672) that specifies the path to a directory, where the backup should be stored.
Relative paths are resolved based on the current user directory, <filepath>user.dir</filepath>, of the JVM where the database backup is occurring.
Relative paths are not resolved based on the derby home directory.
To avoid confusion, use the absolute path.

target.mrk: An input argument of type VARCHAR(32672) that specifies the path to a directory, where the backup should be stored.
Relative paths are resolved based on the current user directory, <filepath>user.dir</filepath>, of the JVM where the database backup is occurring.
Relative paths are not resolved based on the derby home directory.
To avoid confusion, use the absolute path.

seg-source.mrk: Execute privileges

target.mrk: Execute privileges

trans-unit.source: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> has execute privileges on this procedure by default. See "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information. The database owner can grant access to other users.

seg-source.mrk: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> has execute privileges on this procedure by default.
See "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.
The database owner can grant access to other users.

target.mrk: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> has execute privileges on this procedure by default.
See "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.
The database owner can grant access to other users.

seg-source.mrk: JDBC example

target.mrk: JDBC example

trans-unit.source: The following example backs up the database to the <codeph>c:/backupdir</codeph> directory:

seg-source.mrk: The following example backs up the database to the <codeph>c:/backupdir</codeph> directory:

target.mrk: The following example backs up the database to the <codeph>c:/backupdir</codeph> directory:

trans-unit.source: CallableStatement cs = conn.prepareCall ("CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_BACKUP_DATABASE(?)"); cs.setString(1, "c:/backupdir"); cs.execute(); cs.close();

seg-source.mrk: CallableStatement cs = conn.prepareCall ("CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_BACKUP_DATABASE(?)"); cs.setString(1, "c:/backupdir"); cs.execute(); cs.close();

target.mrk: CallableStatement cs = conn.prepareCall ("CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_BACKUP_DATABASE(?)"); cs.setString(1, "c:/backupdir"); cs.execute(); cs.close();

seg-source.mrk: SQL example

target.mrk: SQL example

trans-unit.source: The following example backs up the database to the <codeph>c:/backupdir</codeph> directory:

seg-source.mrk: The following example backs up the database to the <codeph>c:/backupdir</codeph> directory:

target.mrk: The following example backs up the database to the <codeph>c:/backupdir</codeph> directory:

seg-source.mrk: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_BACKUP_DATABASE('c:/backupdir');

target.mrk: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_BACKUP_DATABASE('c:/backupdir');
